title: Stephen Mulhern blasts Jennifer Arcuri as his interview is cut drastically short
text:

Stephen Mulhern took aim a Jennifer Arcuri after his interview was cut drastically short.

The much-loved Catchphrase presenter jokingly shook is fist in anger at the camera while presenter Piers Morgan apologised.

Stephen was supposed to be speaking about travelling the country to find a nativity to put on TV for Christmas Stars.

However, there was barely any time for the host and narrator to speak after over an hour of Good Morning Britain was taken up by the chat with Boris Johnson's former friend.

GMB presenter Piers Morgan said: "We had to cut short the interview. Sorry, obviously because of our big scoop.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

"Good you managed to get 87 plugs in the end there so well done. We’ll get you back on for a more extensive interview."

Mockingly gesturing with his clasped fist, Stephen cried out: "Damn that Jennifer."

Giggling Susanna Reid replied: "You’re probably not the only one saying that this morning."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Stephen was left in hysterics earlier in the quick chat when Piers asked if he'd had an affair with Boris Johnson .

This came after the presenter had repeatedly asked American businesswoman Arcuri whether she had an "intimate relationship" with the Prime Minister.

When asked if he had an affair with Boris, stunned Stephen replied: "Not yet. Fingers crossed."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Attention then turned to fresh-faced Stephen's youthful good looks - with Piers asking if he was in "good health".

"You look svelte and well and handsome, which I’m not enjoying at all," confessed Piers.

Susanna Reid then asked Stephen to reveal his secret to the viewer at home.

(Image: ITV)

"I don't know why," admitted Stephen as he hilariously licked his finger and stroked his eyebrows.

"I’m trying to keep fit. We've just done Catchphrase, Simon Cowell’s new show called Rolling In It. All is good."

*Good Morning Britain airs weekdays on ITV at 10.30am
description: The much-loved TV presenter jokingly shook his fist as Boris Johnson's former friend after Piers Morgan apologised
